results.title: Feelings: what are you afraid of?
results.creator_credit: Abram Murray and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Helps the young viewer understand that everyone experiences fear at some time and that being afraid need not be a subject of embarrassment. Shows a number of children discussing their fears. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Feelings: don't stay mad
results.creator_credit: Abram Murray and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Discusses the fact that people should not let feelings grow until they are overwhelmed by them. Suggests that anger can be talked out or acted out in positive ways. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Feelings of depression
results.creator_credit: Stanley Jackson, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: How and why feelings of depression carry over from childhood to overshadow adulthood are explained in the case of John Murray, an industrious and conscientious businessman. As his case history unfolds we see how persisting reactions to early emotional problems render him incapable of enjoying a happy, normal life. (Award: Toronto)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Jackson, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Feeling yes, feeling no: the adult film
results.creator_credit: Moira Simpson, Jennifer Torrance and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Provides information on how to facilitate a networking workshop for the “Feeling Yes, feeling No” program which provides information on the nature and scope of child sexual assault, the behavioural signs of the sexually assaulted child and the skills necessary to assist a sexual assault victim. Demonstrates the purpose and content of the children’s films and lessons and provides parents and professionals with materials and ideas to reinforce the sexual assault prevention skills the children are taught.

results.title: Feeling yes, feeling no. Parts 1, 2 and 3
results.creator_credit: Moira Simpson, John Taylor, Jennifer Torrance and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Feeling Yes, Feeling No Parts 1, 2 and 3 are part of a sexual - assault - prevention program for young children. The purpose of this video is to give children the skills necessary to protect themselves from sexual assault - from strangers, from family members, from other trusted persons. Part 1 teaches children basic skills that build self-worth, self-confidence and good judgment. Part 2 reinforces the understanding of “Yes” feelings and “No” feelings and introduces skills to keep children assess potentially dangerous situations involving strangers. Part 3, introduces the issue of sexual assault by a trusted adult.

results.title: Reading Australian Film
results.brief_description: This is a film about how to watch films. The reason for making a film is to tell a story by using vision and sound. The finished version often taps into experiences we ourselves have had in real life. But film is not reality… it is a constructed medium which conveys messages of fact, fiction and emotion.

results.creator_credit: Moira Simpson, John Taylor, Jennifer Torrance and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Feeling yes, feeling no Parts 1, 2 and 3 are part of a sexual assault prevention program for young children. The purpose of this video is to give children the skills necessary to protect themselves from sexual assault - from strangers, from family members, from other trusted people. Part 1 teaches children basic skills that build self-worth, self-confidence and good judgement. Part 2 reinforces the understanding of “Yes” feelings and “No” feelings and introduces skills to keep children assess potentially dangerous situations involving strangers. Part 3, introduces the issue of sexual assault by a trusted adult. Cast includes: Barbara Duncan, Fran Gebhard and Brian Torpe. (Awards: Montreal; Oakland; Mauriac)

results.title: Feeling safe staying safe
results.creator_credit: Phil Read, Paul Worthington, South Australian Film Corporation and South Australia. Dept. for Education and Children's Services
results.brief_description: Presents 16 vignettes showing children in a variety of unsafe predicaments, ranging from everyday personal safety situations through to harassment and abuse situations. Each vignette has been designed for use as a single scenario to present to students as part of the problem-solving process and includes students from a variety of cultural and socio-economic backgrounds, from preschool to high school age and with gender as a factor of analysis. Includes support booklet for teacher use. Suitable for primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Reap the wild wind
results.creator_credit: Cecil B. DeMille and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Shipwreck on the Reef, Shipwreck on the Reef, this was the cry the local shipowners and salvage operators in Key West during the 1840’s awaited. Their business thrived on the cargo of wrecked ships but are all the wrecks caused by nature or man made? Why is it that King Cutler (Raymond Massey) always seemed to be the first on the scene? These and other questions are asked by local ship owner Loxi Claiborne (Paulette Goddard) and others. Meanwhile Loxi’s suitor Captain Jack Stuart (John Wayne) is suspected by the jealous lawyer Steve Tolliver (Ray Milland). Who will win in the romance stakes? The star studded cast includes Robert Preston, Susan Heywood, Charles Bickford, Walter Hampden and Janet Beecher. This Cecil B. DeMille production of piracy, hot-blooded love and huge clipper ships gliding in the mist won an Academy Award for its Special Effects and was based on a Saturday Evening Post story by Thelma Strabel.

results.title: Realms of the Russian bear
results.brief_description: From the Volga Delta to the mighty Russian Far East, from huge smoking volcanoes to cold icy coasts, take an incredible journey of exploration into the wildlife and countryside of one of the world’s most remarkable areas. Wildfowl and water birds, leopards and tigers, wild asses and Polar Bears - all are here amongst the amazing variety of creatures befitting this huge, little explored area. Presented by Russian naturalist Nikolai Drozdov, this spectacular award-winning BBC series is a visual feast for all nature lovers.
